intro: Carpotroche longifolia var. heliocarpa, commonly known as the sunseed plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its long, slender leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive fruits that are encased in a fibrous, woody shell. Its seeds are enclosed within these capsules and are often dispersed by wind. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest in both botanical research and horticultural cultivation.
